text: hey guys Thomas Joseph here now how many
times have you run into this kitchen
conundrum you're about to make your
favorite pancake recipe and you realize
that you don't have buttermilk in your
refrigerator or maybe you just don't
have enough well today I'm going to
share with you four simple homemade
buttermilk substitutions that take only
five minutes or less so to start what is
buttermilk buttermilk is milk that has
been acidified or cultured and it has
this thick richness to it and what it
does it really helps in leavening a lot
of baked goods and also it gives a
signature flavor so we're gonna
replicate this today and the first way
is with regular whole milk so one cup of
whole milk and to that you're going to
add a tablespoon of vinegar now you
could also use lemon juice here or
another type of vinegar I'm using just
distilled vinegar mix this together and
let it sit for about five minutes and it
will start to thicken and curdle the
second and third way is with yogurt or
sour cream this is plain yogurt I'm just
going to thin it out with a little bit
of whole milk you want to achieve the
same consistency as buttermilk so add a
little bit of milk at a time stir it
together until it's the same consistency
as store-bought buttermilk so off to the
side now the last method in making a
homemade substitute for buttermilk is
with whole milk and cream of tartar so
what you need is one in three quarter
teaspoons of cream of tartar and cream
of tartar is an acid so this is what's
going to acidify your milk and now to
dissolve the cream of tartar it's add a
little bit of milk and then add the rest
a cup in total so mix this together let
it sit for about five minutes until it's
thick and curdled and there you go for
simple easy homemade substitutions for
buttermilk the next time you find
yourself in a pickle without buttermilk
try one of these
you
